items.description: River Lavant
items.message: The River Lavant is high, following above average rainfall in February. Minor flood impacts will continue to affect fields, rural roads and gardens between West Dean and Westhampnett. In East Lavant water may affect Sheepwash Lane, Pook Lane and the Green, and possibly access bridges across the river. Scattered showers through Saturday will cause the River Lavant to rise a few centimetres, beginning to fall by 20:00 02/03/2024. More flood water will affect fields, gardens and roads between East Dean and Westhampnett. At the Sadlers in Westhampnett river levels will be close to properties, but in Chichester City Centre only minimal flood impacts are expected. Very little rain is forecast Saturday afternoon and Sunday. More rain is predicted Monday. The River Lavant could rise another 10-20cm. Plan to avoid driving routes vulnerable to flooding including Sheepwash Lane. If you see a blockage affecting the river, please call our incident hotline on 0800 80 70 60. We are managing structures in Westhampnett to reduce the flood risk. We will update this message by 12:00 03/03/2024.

items.description: Lower River Ems
items.message: Twice the average amount of rain has fallen in February. The River Ems is high. Scattered showers throughout Saturday could see another 10mm of rain fall. Minor flooding could affect fields, rural roads, gardens and approach properties on North Street, River Street and at the Wren Centre, Westbourne. Minor flooding could also affect Brook Meadows, near Lumley Mill and Victoria Terrace, Emsworth. Very little rain is forecast Saturday afternoon and Sunday. River levels should slowly fall a few centimetres Saturday afternoon and Sunday. However, another 10-20mm of rain could occur Monday. On Monday it is possible river levels could rise higher than 04/01/2024. Flood protection products are recommended to be installed in Westbourne and Emsworth, if you have them. Flooding may occur in a short space of time, so please be prepared. We are operating our structure at Constant Springs and clearing grilles. We will update this message by 12:00 03/03/2024

items.description: River Piddle from Alton Pancras to Wareham
items.message: River levels are high due to the recent heavy rain and the influence of groundwater.  We are monitoring rainfall and river levels and are checking rivers for blockages in the area.  We will continue to monitor the forecast and re-issue this warning if necessary.  Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses and do not attempt to walk or drive through flood water.  Remain safe and be aware of your surroundings.  This message will be updated by 4pm on 04/03/24 or if the situation changes.

items.description: Bersted on the Aldingbourne Rife
items.message: The Aldingbourne Rife is high. Flood water will continue to be near to properties on Durban Road, in Bersted. Flooding will also affect fields near Shripney Lane and the A259, the car park at Tesco on Shripney Road and land and caravans at Riverside Caravan Centre. Scattered showers through Saturday will cause river levels to continue rising. Very little rain is forecast Saturday afternoon and Sunday. River levels should begin to fall Sunday in Bersted and should remain lower than they were in January 2024. More rain is predicted Monday. Hopefully from Tuesday 05/03/2024 river levels will be able to fall further, but flood impacts could remain in Bersted until next weekend (10/03/2024). The Aldingbourne Rife might not return nearer to normal until April. Some roads will be affected by flood water, please plan to avoid driving through routes vulnerable to flooding, including Shripney Lane. We are running our pumps at Felpham and keeping grilles clear to help reduce the flood risk. We will update this message by 12:00 03/03/2024.

items.description: Bulverhythe on the Combe Haven
items.message: River levels in Bulverhythe are still high, but have fallen half a metre since Monday. Despite scattered showers Saturday, river levels are forecast to continue to slowly fall. Probably through to Monday 04/03/2024, when another 10-20mm of rain is forecast. River levels will not fall far or fast. Flooding will continue to affect gardens of properties on Bexhill Road close to the Combe Haven river, and possibly gardens on Bulverhythe Road and riverside areas of Combe Haven Holiday Park. In Bulverhythe, each midday and midnight, the incoming tide will cause the water level to rise by approximately 20cm. Flood risk could remain through to 06/03/2024 and river levels in Bulverhythe could remain higher than normal until next weekend (10/03/2024). If you have personal, business or community flood plans please consider enacting them. We continue to monitor the levels and forecast. We will update this message by 12:00 03/03/2024

items.description: Groundwater flooding in Chesham
items.message:
Groundwater levels have responded to high Autumn and Winter rainfall and have risen to high levels at our observation borehole at Ashley Green, Chesham. Groundwater levels are unusually high for this time of year and have now reached a level where communities in Chesham such as the Vale Road area are at risk of being affected by flooding from groundwater. 

We expect levels to remain high over the coming weeks in response to the high winter rainfall. Low lying lands and roads will therefore be at risk of flooding. 

Due to the nature of groundwater behaviour this situation could continue for several weeks or longer. We are continuing to monitor groundwater levels and will update this message on Wednesday 6th March 2024 or as the situation changes.

items.description: Groundwater flooding in Flamstead
items.message:
Groundwater levels have responded to high Autumn and Winter rainfall and have risen to very high levels at our observation borehole at River Hill, close to Flamstead. Groundwater levels are unusually high for this time of year and have now reached a level where communities are at risk of being affected by flooding from groundwater. 

Though levels have declined slightly since their late February peak, we expect levels to remain high over the coming weeks in response to the high winter rainfall. Low lying lands and roads such as those in the Trowley Bottom area near Flamstead will therefore be at risk of flooding.   

Due to the nature of groundwater behaviour this situation could continue for several weeks or longer. We are continuing to monitor groundwater levels and will update this message on Wednesday 6th March 2024, or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Wye and The Hughenden Stream
items.message:
Property flooding is not currently expected. 
River levels have fallen, but remain high, on the River Wye and Hughenden Stream following recent rainfall and high groundwater levels. Therefore, flooding of roads and low lying land remains possible through today, 01/03/2024, especially in areas closest to the Hughenden Stream in High Wycombe. The weather forecast is for showers this morning which will clear this evening leaving a mostly dry day tomorrow. We expect river levels to remain high and sensitive to further rainfall over the coming days. 
We are monitoring the situation. Avoid using low lying footpaths near local watercourses. Go to the 'River and Sea levels in England' webpage for current river levels. This message will be updated tomorrow morning, 03/03/2024, or as the situation changes.

items.description: Lower Itchen
items.message: The water level in the Lower River Itchen at Bishopstoke is high and rising. In the last 12 hours, 10mm of rain was recorded at Otterbourne. This is a modest amount, but follows weeks of prolonged wet weather. Today (Friday 01/03/2024) there will be out of bank flooding affecting Bishopstoke Road Playing Fields, and possibly some gardens in Bishopstoke. Water may also affect the top of Duttons Lane and Withy Meadows, Eastleigh. Further rainfall is forecast to affect the area on Saturday morning (02/03/2024), with up to 15mm possible. Water levels will remain high throughout this time and flood impacts will increase. Our operational staff will keep the river free of blockages. Please take action to ensure you can protect your property over the next few days. This Flood Alert will be updated by 15:00 on 02/03/2024.

items.description: River Bourne at Southampton Road Industrial Park, Salisbury
items.message: River levels are high and rising in the River Bourne due to the recent heavy rainfall and groundwater influx.  Flooding is forecast to affect locations near the River Bourne, with low lying land expected to be most affected, particularly around Southampton Road Industrial Estate, Dolphin Park Industrial Estate and the Muttons Bridge area.  River levels are expected to remain high, and the risk of flooding to roads remains.  We will continue to monitor levels closely.  Please monitor your local water levels and weather conditions.  Consider putting your flood plan into action.  You should avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water.  This message will be updated by 05:00 PM on 04/03/2024, or as the situation changes.

items.description: Lower Test
items.message: At Romsey and Testwood, levels in the River Test are high and continue to rise. In the last 48 hours, 23mm has been recorded in Romsey and follows weeks of prolonged wet weather. Currently (02/03/2024), there is a significant amount of water flooding land and fields from Timsbury to Romsey. At Romsey Industrial estate, water may be ponded on land near to Greatbridge Road. Land at Broadlands and Testwood will also flood. For the rest of today (02/03/2024) and tomorrow (03/03/2024), the weather is forecast to be more settled. However, further rain is forecast for Monday (up to 15mm) with showers over the coming week. Flood impacts will remain throughout this period. Land at Romsey and Testwood may remain flooded over the next 2 to 3 weeks. We are managing sluices to balance water levels through the town. We recommend private sluice owners undertake regular sluice operations. Flooded land at Testwood may require livestock to be moved. This Flood Alert will be updated by 11:00 on Sunday 03/03/2024.

items.description: Rivers Gade and Bulbourne
items.message:
River levels are rising on the Rivers Gade and Bulbourne due to heavy rainfall. 

No property flooding is currently expected. 

Further rainfall is forecast throughout today, Saturday 2nd March. We are monitoring rainfall and river levels. 

Monitor local water levels and weather conditions. Consider putting your flood plan into action. You should avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water.

This message will be updated by 6pm today, or as the situation changes.

items.description: Tillingbourne
items.message: Property flooding is not currently expected. River levels are rising on the Tillingbourne as a result of a period of sustained rain. Therefore flooding of low lying land and roads is expected today, 02/03/24 especially in the Shalford area. Further scattered showers are forecast today and into tomorrow. We expect river levels to remain responsive to further rainfall. Avoid using low lying footpaths near local watercourses. Go to the 'River and Sea levels in England' webpage for current river levels. This message will be updated by tomorrow morning, 03/03/24, or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Chess in the Chilterns and Three Rivers Districts
items.message:
River levels have risen on the Chess and are expected to remain high. 

Flooding is forecast to affect locations near the Chess, with low lying land expected to be most affected, particularly around Pednormead End, Missenden Road, Scotsbridge, Chesham, and Rickmansworth.

Further rainfall is forecast this afternoon, Saturday 2nd March, but it is expected to ease overnight.

We are in the area responding to reports of flooding and we will continue to monitor levels closely.

Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses and do not attempt to walk or drive through flood water.

This message will be updated by 10am tomorrow on Sunday 3rd March, or as the situation changes.
